Transcript: Chris: Can't tell you how much I appreciate this.
Clerk: Appreciate what?

Jack's voice: Hey, Livvie, it's Jack. I guess I kind of disappeared on you 
the last few days. I decided to go talk to my probation officer in Westford and 
figure out how to fix this mess. I know you wanted to go with me, but, yeah, I 
guess this was something I had to do on my own. But, hey, I'm back and I really, 
really, really want to see you. So call me when you pick this up or just come to 
the Recovery Room. I don't care how late it is, ok? Miss you. See you.
[Answering machine beeps]
Voice on answering machine: Message deleted.
Livvie: Chris!
Chris: Hi.
Livvie: What are you doing in my room?
Kevin: Lucy? Lucy, if this doesn't feel right, just say so and we'll stop.
Lucy: No, Doc, it's not me. It's you. This has to feel right for you.
Eve: Ian, make love to me. Oh.
Ian: No.
Eve: What? Why?
Ian: I've never wanted anyone more in my life. But we can't do this.
[telephone rings]
Jack: Recovery Room. No. No, you got the wrong number. Yeah, yeah.
Jamal: Look, look, look, what's up with that? Huh?

Jack: Hey, I gave Livvie the number on her answering machine to call here. 
You didn't happen to take a call from her, did you?
Jamal: Who, me? No, I haven't.
Jack: Damn.
Jamal: I thought you guys were supposed to be all tight and everything.

Jack: We are. Or, well, we were. She happened to find out that I got in 
some trouble and it kind of shook things up a little bit.
Jamal: Ah, trouble.
Jack: Yeah.
Jamal: You mean, like, car trouble, huh?
Jack: You could say that.
Jamal: Oh, yeah? What else could you say?

Jack: Look, I stole one, all right? But it was no big deal. It was a long 
time ago.
Jamal: That's why you haven't been around, then, huh?

Jack: Well, I had to back and check in with my probation officer and make 
sure everything was, you know, straightened out.
Jamal: So did you straighten everything out?

Jack: Yeah, better than ever. I mean, I have a chance to stay here in Port 
Charles if I get a steady job.
Jamal: So any chance your big brother could help you out with that?
[Jack laughs]

Jack: Yeah, maybe out the door. All Chris wants is basically to use my bad 
luck to turn Livvie against me.
Chris: Oh, Livvie. You surprised me.
Livvie: How'd you get in my room?

Chris: The maid let me in. She knew we were friends and I just told her I 
wanted to leave you a note. I was just about to write it when you showed up, 
here you are.
Livvie: Great, now you can tell me to my face. What's the big emergency?
Chris: I just wondered if you'd spoken to Jack.
Livvie: Why?

Chris: Well, nobody's seen him since he, you know, told us how he'd broken 
probation and I thought he might've skipped town.
Livvie: Yeah, well, he wouldn't do that without telling me first.
Chris: Yeah. You know, Livvie, you really shouldn't expect too much from him.

Livvie: Yeah, well, I believe in people. Besides, I think I know why you're 
so worried about Jack and me.
Chris: You do?

Livvie: Yeah. I mean, obviously I think it has something to do with the other 
night when you walked in on us and we were -- you know -- together.

Chris: I'll admit that threw me. But you're an adult and I'm not going to 
tell you how to live your life.
Livvie: Well, that's a relief.
Chris: I will, however, question who you choose to live it with.
Livvie: Jack is your brother.

Chris: Yeah, and I'm afraid he's going to try to use you to get to me and 
you're going to wind up getting your heart broken in the process.

Livvie: Oh, Chris! Sometimes you make it so hard for me to breathe. You need 
to understand that anything happening between Jack and me is with my eyes wide 
open, including the other night. If I'm going to make any mistakes, they're mine 
to make.
Chris: But if you get hurt because of me --
Livvie: I promise, I will not hold you responsible.

Ian: Clearly, I've lost my mind. This is what I wanted -- to have you with 
me, to hold you, to make love to you, and get lost in you. And now --
Eve: Why do we have to stop?
Ian: Because I love you. And one moment in time couldn't nearly be enough.
Eve: I -- I don't understand.

Ian: I don't just want you for one night. I want you for always. Do you 
remember when I took that poison? I was just laying there and I heard your voice 
and I saw your face -- through whatever my brain was drowning in -- and I 
thought, "You know what, Ian? If you got to die now, it'd be all right because 
you're in her arms." And I realized that when that day comes, be it today or 
tomorrow or, God willing, in 100 years from now, there's no place I'd rather be. 
Do you understand?
Eve: I think so.

Ian: I want us to have a life together. Someplace where it would fill our 
souls, with tiny little rugrats that look like you running around.
[Eve sighs]
Ian: Could you stand it, Lambert? A whole lifetime of our kind of mayhem?
Eve: You take my breath away with your blarney.

Ian: No, no, no, no. Every word is true. I want us to grow old together and 
still love each other. And we will, I know it. I saw it from the first moment I 
met you. And I know it now. It's fate or destiny or whatever you want to call 
it. We need to live this out, Eve.
Eve: How can you be so sure?
Ian: After everything we've been through, how can you not be?

Kevin: I don't blame you for having second thoughts after what I put you 
through the other night.
Lucy: No, no, no. I don't want you to ever apologize to me about that.
Kevin: But I don't ever want to hurt you.

Lucy: And you won't, Doc. You couldn't. You wouldn't unless you woke up 
tomorrow morning and you regretted something we did -- or something we didn't do 
tonight.
[Kevin sighs]

Kevin: You know, I don't what it is, Lucy, but we just keep coming back into 
each other's lives time and again, no matter what we've been through or whoever 
we've loved. Somehow our connection just never seems to be broken. Seems that 
you are the constant in my life. But I can't go back. I've changed. I'm 
different. We both are. But, Lucy, you make me feel that it's possible to have a 
future. But I never want to make you feel less than you are.
Lucy: You mean, because of Eve?
Kevin: I loved her, Lucy. And I'll never be able to forget her.

Lucy: I know that. And I don't want you to. She was your wife. And if you 
felt any different, then you simply wouldn't be the man that I -- I care so very 
much about.
Kevin: It's not that simple.

Lucy: Doc, it is. It is that simple. I am the person that can help you get 
through all of this pain and I'm the person that can make you see what a 
wonderful future you can have. So, please -- believe me, it's not wrong for you 
to need me.

Kevin: You know, just standing here and looking in your eyes -- I can't 
explain it, but there's something there. It's something familiar. And it's the 
reason we've been connected all this time.

Lucy: Oh, Doc. There has always, always been a very special place in my heart 
saved 
just for you.

Ian: Can you tell me that after everything we've been through, you don't feel 
the way I do? Have I misread you that completely?

Eve: No. No. I feel exactly the same way you do. I want to grow old together, 
too. But there's someone I need to talk to.
Ian: Kevin.
Eve: Where do I even begin?

Ian: Why don't we just take off and disappear and live our lives on a nice, 
warm tropical island? Everyone thinks we're dead anyway. Who would know the 
difference?
Eve: We would. I owe Kevin at least that much.
Ian: Of course you do.

Eve: You know, in spite of everything, he's -- he is my husband and I -- 
there's a part of me that still loves him.
Ian: I know.

Eve: I mean, it's not like us. I realized that over the last few weeks. I 
have never felt this way about anyone. It's like -- I come first with you.
Ian: First and last, you're everything to me, Eve.

Eve: But I got to be honest with you. It's pretty scary feeling so connected 
to someone else.
Ian: It's a good fit.

Eve: I've never known what it's like to sacrifice myself so completely for 
someone else and not feel like it's a sacrifice at all. You know? And I know 
that you would do the same thing for me.
Ian: Whenever you need it.
Eve: That's why I can't walk away from this. I can't let you go.
Ian: I won't let you.
[Knock on door]
Eve: Oh, my God! What if it's Harris' men?
Ian: Shh. Hello?
Man: It's the sheriff. You folks ok?
[Eve sighs]
Ian: Actually, we're not. Come on in.
Sheriff: This cabin doesn't get used very much.

Eve: We were kidnapped. Ok? We'll tell you all about it on the way to Port 
Charles.
Ian: Do you know how to get there?
Sheriff: Of course I do.
Ian: Ok, well, we're just going to close up this place. We'll be right out.
Sheriff: I'll wait outside.
Eve: Ok.
Eve: It looks like I tell Kevin tonight.
[Music plays]
Eve: Here. We'll return these later.
Eve: This place doesn't quite seem so warm anymore, does it?
Ian: You ready?
Eve: As I'll ever be. I'll never forget this place.
Ian: Yeah. I'm going to miss it, too.
Eve: But we have the rest of our lives to tell each other how in love we are.
Ian: I do love you, Eve.
Eve: I love you, Ian.
Ian: Come on.
[cab door closes]
Ian: Keep the meter running.
Eve: Well, here we are. Mine and Kevin's place.
Ian: You ok?
Eve: I'm scared to death.
Ian: I told you I'll go with you. All you have to do is ask.

Eve: I know, but this is -- this is something I have to do alone. God, I 
didn't realize how hard this was going to be. Once I tell Kevin that I'm in love 
with you, the fact that I'm alive might not be such good news.
Ian: I'm not moving from this place till you get back, I promise you.
Eve: I will run, not walk, to get back here with you, my love. I promise.
Kevin: Oh!
[Kevin sighs]
Lucy: Ok, so -- it should be illegal to feel this happy.
Kevin: Well, I guess they'll just have to cart me off to the slammer, then.
[Lucy sighs]

Kevin: You said something the other night that suddenly I realized what you 
meant.
Lucy: Oh, I say way too many things. What did I say?

Kevin: "Welcome home." I realize you weren't talking about this place or any 
place. You were talking about right here. You and me. You're my home, Lucy.
Eve: Oh! Man.
[Eve sighs]
Eve: Kevin, why didn't you hide the key under the mat like you wanted to?
[Knock]
Lucy: Are you expecting somebody?
Kevin: No.
Lucy: Oh. Well, maybe you should answer it.
Kevin: Like this? Nah, I don't think so.
[Knock]
Lucy: I don't think they're going to go away.
Kevin: Well, they will if we ignore them.
Lucy: What if it's something very important?
[Louder knocks]
Kevin: There's nothing more important than right here.
Eve: Oh, you're probably on duty.
[Thud]
[Tires squeal]
Ian: Eve!
>> On the next "Port Charles" --
Karen: Oh, I never realized you had this gift.
Frank: It's one of my lesser known talents.
Kevin: Excuse me, I'm a doctor. Can I help? Ian. Eve. Oh, my God.
